programme.title: Savage Kingdom
programme.desc: Not all lions in the Savage Kingdom are born equal while the Marsh Pride dominates the beating heart of the realm, the three lionesses of the Northern Pride struggle to hold their ground in the forests and hills. Once a great pride, their sons have been banished, and if they can't rebuild their pride they face hunger, exile or worse..

programme.title: Savage Kingdom
programme.desc: Matsumi, has ascended to become Queen of the Marsh Pride. An unrivalled hunter, she has yet to prove herself as the leader of the dynasty that controls the beating heart of her Savage Kingdom the Great Marsh. Her rivals and The Kingdoms brutal climate do everything they can to bring her clan to its knees. Will the price of success be too high for the Marsh Pride to pay?.

programme.title: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: No matter how hard we try to figure them out, animals are just plain unpredictable. It's Animals Gone Wild: Bizarre Encounters.

programme.title: Savage Kingdom

programme.title: Dr. Oakley, Yukon Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Oakley participates in a race pitting human runners against reindeer, five muskox undergo pregnancy tests, and Daisy participates in a family reunion.

programme.title: Dr. Oakley, Yukon Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Oakley sees two stubborn muskoxen and a particularly wily coyote. A badly burned dog receives an innovative, if fishy, new treatment..

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals wage a covert war for survival, deploying their hidden weapons with deadly precision. These adaptations, forged by eons of evolution, give animals the edge they need to outwit predators, rivals, and the elements. From the bombardier beetle's boiling spray to the mantis shrimp's explosive club and the draco lizard‚Äôs hidden wings, meet nature's awesome secret weapons.

programme.title: Return Of The Predators
programme.desc: After 30 years of war and destruction, Gorongosa National Park in Mozambique has undergone a remarkable restoration. Herbivores once again bound across the plains, but hunters have been slower to return, leaving the park out of balance..until now!.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals survive by using camouflage, mimicry, and stealth tactics. From tigers who hunt in plain sight using their orange fur as camouflage, and a spider who mimics an ant to sneak into a colony, to a bird that uses false alarm calls to trick meerkats into giving up their prey, nature deploys remarkable deception to survive.
